# React + TypeScript + Vite Project Instructions

## Project Overview
This is a React application built with TypeScript and Vite, providing a fast development environment with Hot Module Replacement (HMR).

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites
- Node.js (v18+)
- npm

### Development
```bash
npm run dev
```
The dev server runs on `http://localhost:5173/`

### Build
```bash
npm run build
```

### Preview
```bash
npm run preview
```

### Linting
```bash
npm run lint
```

## Project Structure
- `/src` - Application source code
  - `App.tsx` - Main App component
  - `App.css` - App styles
  - `main.tsx` - Entry point
- `/public` - Static assets
- `vite.config.ts` - Vite configuration
- `tsconfig.json` - TypeScript configuration
- `eslint.config.js` - ESLint rules

## Key Features
- React 18 with TypeScript
- Vite for fast builds and HMR
- ESLint for code quality
- Modern development tooling

## Available Scripts
- `npm run dev` - Start development server
- `npm run build` - Build for production
- `npm run preview` - Preview production build
- `npm run lint` - Run ESLint

## Notes
- The React Compiler is disabled by default to optimize dev/build performance
- See README.md for information on expanding ESLint configuration
